meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in a pitching competition.
meanings.sent1: She outpitched her opponent in the baseball game.
meanings.sent2: The pitcher outpitched all others in the tournament.
meanings.sent3: The young pitcher was outpitching like a pro, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outpitch her rivals was as strong as a steel wall.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her outpitching echoed through the stadium.

meanings.definition: To perform better than in a pitching contest.
meanings.sent1: He always outpitched his teammates during practice.
meanings.sent2: The rookie player was outpitching the experienced ones effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be outpitching the dog in the game of fetch.
meanings.sent4: Her outpitching skills were like a magic spell, mesmerizing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone brightly on her outpitching performance, making it shine even more.
